author: Where Oceans Meet

text:
This is a musical masterpiece. I am new to Postie's music because...well my own ignorance. I judged. I judged him by his appearance and wow, what a mistake. I myself have been judged by my appearance for my whole life post puberty. It is hurtful, damaging, ignorant, and it's unacceptable. I want to apologize for doing the same thing to Post Malone that was done to me causing irreparable damage to my self esteem and the way I have valued myself since I was 11 years old. I'm 42 now and people still judge and label me  based on my appearance. I will never let myself do that to another human being ever again. 
This man is a genius. A true musician. A gentleman. A beautiful human being. A legend. Go Postie go!!

text: This album very very recently was with me through one of the hardest times of my life that I’m still trying to heal from. The month of August was so brutal. And I was listening to this album every single day on repeat through it. I think I have to say… this might be one of my favorite albums of all time and it hurts so much that I can’t listen to it right now because of the pain associated. I hope as I heal it will become less painful for me to listen to this album considering I love it so much and it means so much to me. Music is insanely powerful and it’s a gift to be able to connect with people so deeply the way Post does 💗

text: Post has had an album for each important time of my life, and especially the last three albums. In 2019, he released Hollywood Bleeding in early September when I was leaving France and my dad while not knowing I would stay 3 years not seeing him (I live in China, and Covid would stop all possibility of travel only a few months later). Post released Twelve Carat Toothache last year just when my dad was diagnosed with Pancreatic Cancer and Austin came out less than a month after my dad passed away. I don't believe in any sign or anything, but all of this gave Postie's songs a very deep meaning in my heart.
author: Greg李格
